The Neo is a $20,000 a humanoid-robot wrapped in a onesie that can fold your laundry and clean up when you're hungover.
But this particular robot is only the beginning - 1x is just one of many companies with billions of VC dollars burning a hole in their pocket and they won't stop until they've ushered in the robot apocalypse.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TechWorld with Nana]From QA to DevOps - How I Learned DevOps to future-proof my career

ns2:group.ns2:title: From QA to DevOps - How I Learned DevOps to future-proof my career
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Rody's journey: Learn the skills that matter and how to learn them without quitting your job â–º Get your DevOps Starter Kit here: https://bit.ly/4oIb2ZF â–º Get Demo Projects from our website: https://bit.ly/3L7rtAa
Rody (15 years in QA) shares his career journey from being a senior test automation engineer to embracing DevOps and eventually transitioning to freelance work.
I'm breaking down this full interview about the future of QA and test automation and the real impact of AI on testing roles. You will learn the specific skills that matter, how to learn them without quitting your job and the specific path that he took to become a highly demanded future-proof engineer. And throughout this conversation, I will break down the technical concepts and what this means for you. Whether you are in QA engineering, thinking about DevOps or transitioning from a different background or just trying to understand where engineering careers are heading.
#devopscareer #devops #testautomation
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ Thanks Rody, for being so open and sharing your journey with the community ğŸ’™ â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ â–º Learn more about QA: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P3-8CNCS50k â–º Connect with Rody on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/rody-bothe-0a205066/
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ ğŸ™ï¸ PART OF NEW INTERVIEW SERIES ğŸ™ï¸ â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ This series features in-depth conversations with industry experts like Kelsey Hightower and real career journeys, from people who made it happen, sharing practical insights on learning paths, interview preparation, and day-to-day DevOps work.
From manual QA to DevOps. From network engineering to cloud architecture. From non-tech backgrounds to DevSecOps lead.
I capture real transformation stories from our DevOps bootcamp graduates about building a DevOps career. Hear how people learned Kubernetes, prepared project portfolios, landed multiple job offers, and navigate the evolving landscape of AI in infrastructure. Whether you're considering DevOps or already in the field, these conversations reveal what's actually working.
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ T I M E S T A M P S â° â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ 00:00 Introduction to Rody & Overview 01:44 The Shift to DevOps in QA 03:58 The Day-to-Day Pain 08:51 Rody's Career Decision 12:15 Learning DevOps: The Initial Steps 22:00 Balancing Family and Learning 26:26 Connecting the dots & Applying it at work 26:53 Was it worth it? 33:01 The 5-Minute Hire 36:49 Test Automation Role in 5 or 10 years 37:55 The AI Reality 41:47 Next Career Steps - DevSecOps 44:32 Advice for QAs - Where to start? 47:41 What would you do differently? 50:11 4 Practical Takeaways for you
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ Connect with me ğŸ‘‹ â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ INSTAGRAM â–º https://bit.ly/2F3LXYJ TWITTER â–º https://bit.ly/3i54PUB LINKEDIN â–º https://bit.ly/3hWOLVT

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]The Most Powerful Predictor of Team Success | Rafael Chiuzi | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Most Powerful Predictor of Team Success | Rafael Chiuzi | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Remember that gut-clenching fear of speaking up in class? Organizational psychologist Rafael Chiuzi reveals how that same feeling shows up in the workplace, limiting productivity and the free exchange of ideas. Backed by decades of research and hands-on consulting, he unpacks the science of psychological safety â€” and shares three actionable steps to build teams where curiosity thrives and courage replaces fear. (Recorded at TEDxMcMasterU on March 5, 2022)

ns2:group.ns2:title: LIVE DevOps Career Workshop
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Learn what it really takes to level up your career with DevOps | Make 2026 the Year You Go DevOps
We'll cover: The actual skills companies are hiring for right now How to read between the lines of DevOps job descriptions (we'll decode them together) How to bridge the gap from where you are to where you want to be Real talk about certifications, projects, and what actually matters The roadmap that's worked for people who've made the switch

Unilumin isnâ€™t just making brighter screens â€” theyâ€™re integrating artificial intelligence directly into their LED panels, transforming them into interactive digital assistants. ns2:group.ns2:title: ã€æ­£ç‰‡ã€‘è´¾æ¨ŸæŸ¯Ã—ç½—æ°¸æµ©ï¼æˆä¸ºè´¾æ¨ŸæŸ¯ï¼ˆä¸Šï¼‰ ï½œ CrossRoads Ep.9: Becoming Jia Zhangke: Part One
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Director Jia Zhangke joins CrossRoads with Luo Yonghao for an intimate conversation on cinema, memory, and becoming himself. From Platform to Still Life, his lens captures ordinary people and fading times â€” revealing the quiet pulse of Chinaâ€™s transformation.
While most cameras chase neon skylines and tales of heroes, Jia Zhangkeâ€™s lens has always stayed grounded â€” focused on the soil beneath his feet. In his films, there are few grand battles or dramatic rescues â€” only the quiet pulse of life in Shanxiâ€™s small towns: coal mines, motorcycles, county dance troupes, drifting youth, and the fragile silhouettes of people caught between eras. Those forgotten by history find their voices in Jiaâ€™s frame â€” ordinary, steady, yet resonant â€” echoing from the skies over Fenyang to the nights of Venice. In this ninth episode of Crossroads with Luo Yonghao, we sit down with director Jia Zhangke, a filmmaker whose works (Platform, Still Life, A Touch of Sin, Mountains May Depart, Ash Is Purest White) continue to map the emotional geography of modern China. To converse with Jia is to step into his cinema: honest, grounded, calm, and deeply human. His words, like his images, reveal the unseen currents beneath ordinary life â€” where longing meets history, the mundane finds a voice, and silence tells its own truth. Together, we trace the journey of a once-restless youth wandering the streets of Fenyang â€” who found his way, step by step, to the Golden Lion stage of the Venice Film Festival. ã€Šç½—æ°¸æµ©çš„åå­—è·¯å£ã€‹æ’­å®¢èŠ‚ç›®ç®€ä»‹ æœ¬èŠ‚â½¬æ˜¯â¼€æ¡£ç”±ç½—æ°¸æµ©ä¸»æŒçš„æ·±åº¦æ’­å®¢ç±»èŠ‚â½¬ï¼Œæ¯é›†é•¿è¾¾ä¸‰åˆ°äº”ä¸ªå°æ—¶ã€‚ æˆ‘ä»¬ä¸æ—¶ä»£æµªæ½®ä¸­çš„â¼ˆç‰©å±•å¼€å¯¹è¯ï¼Œèšç„¦äºç§‘æŠ€ä¸â¼ˆâ½‚é¢†åŸŸï¼Œè®²è¿°ä¸ªä½“å‘½è¿æ•…äº‹ï¼Œæ¢è®¨æ—¶ä»£å‘å±•è¶‹åŠ¿ã€‚

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Shop, Earn, Celebrate: Flybuys Unplugged | Retail Insights with AWS

ns2:group.ns2:title: Shop, Earn, Celebrate: Flybuys Unplugged | Retail Insights with AWS
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Full episode: https://youtu.be/TcrwBJoPLj0
Join us for a captivating conversation with Anna Lee, CEO of Flybuys, Australiaâ€™s leading coalition loyalty program, as we uncover how Flybuys is revolutionizing customer experience through data-driven innovation and personalized engagement.
In this episode, hosts Lucy Moffat (Head of Cross Industry, ANZ) and Isha Dalal (Enterprise Solutions Architect) take you behind the scenes of Flybuysâ€™ journey, showcasing how everyday shopping is being transformed into truly rewarding experiences for millions across Australia. Discover how Flybuys has grown from a classic loyalty program to a vibrant part of daily life, creating moments of delight and connecting people to their favourite retail partners.
Discover how Flybuys is evolving far beyond pointsâ€”using advanced analytics to deliver hyper-personalized offers, reimagining routine shopping into magical moments, and helping Australians maximize value in their everyday lives across a vast network of retail partners like Coles, Wesfarmers, Kmart, and Bunnings. Anna shares candid insights into the journey of digitizing member engagement, uplifting data and communications platforms, and building a customer-first culture through technology, people empowerment, and agile collaboration.
Visit Flybuys: experience.flybuys.com.au
Hear firsthand how personalized data, technology, and member-centric design are putting Flybuys at the heart of millions of Australiansâ€™ daily lives.
Learn more about AWS Retail solutions: http://go.aws/4objzDU
#AWS #Retail #AI #DigitalTransformation #AmazonWebServices #CloudComputing

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]When it comes to muscles: Use them before you lose them #HowToBeABetterHuman #TEDTalks

ns2:group.ns2:title: When it comes to muscles: Use them before you lose them #HowToBeABetterHuman #TEDTalks
ns2:group.ns2:description: Did you know that you start losing muscle mass as soon as the age of 30? Author and surfer Bonnie Tsui explores how to build strength as you age with Chris Duffy, host of the "How to Be a Better Human" podcast. Watch as Bonnie tries to teach Chris how to surf while weaving in lessons on the benefits of weightlifting, maintaining mobility and adding more movement into your life.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]AWS Global Infrastructure | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: AWS Global Infrastructure | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) delivers the most secure, reliable, and extensive global cloud infrastructure so that customers can build, run, and scale their applications with confidence. Learn about the comprehensive AWS Global Infrastructure offerings that enable you to run your applications wherever you need.
Learn more about AWS Global Infrastructure: http://go.aws/47p29wU
Subscribe to AWS: https://go.aws/subscribe
Create a free AWS account: https://go.aws/signup Try AWS for free: https://go.aws/free Connect with an expert: https://go.aws/contact Explore more: https://go.aws/more
Next steps: Explore on AWS in Analyst Research: https://go.aws/reports Discover, deploy, and manage software that runs on AWS: https://go.aws/marketplace Join the AWS Partner Network: https://go.aws/partners Learn more on how Amazon builds and operates software: https://go.aws/library
Do you have technical AWS questions? Ask the community of experts on AWS re:Post: https://go.aws/3lPaoPb
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services is the worldâ€™s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud, enabling customers to build anything they can imagine. We offer the greatest choice of innovative cloud capabilities and expertise, on the most extensive global infrastructure with industry-leading security, reliability, and performance.
#AWS #AmazonWebServices #CloudComputing

ns2:group.ns2:title: Introducing Amazon Nova Multimodal Embeddings | Amazon Web Services

In this video, Denise from the Product Marketing team shows you how view customization works in shared projects, including how to reset to the default view and set a standard view for your whole team.
Helpful Timestamps: 00:00 Intro 00:09 Customize your view of a shared project 01:20 Reset to the projectâ€™s default view 01:33 Change the default view of a shared project 02:05 Outro

Start a team for free â†’ https://app.todoist.com/app/teams/create Each team comes with 5 free projects. Upgrade to the Business plan as your needs grow. â†’ https://todoist.com/pricing

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]AWS Innovation with Inovalon | Innovation Ambassadors | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: AWS Innovation with Inovalon | Innovation Ambassadors | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Explore the intersection of healthcare and AI with Inovalon and AWS. Our host Sara welcomes Dr. Paige Kilian (CMO, Inovalon), Kate Marta (VP, Clinical Quality & Innovation), Rachel Stemerman (Principal TPM), Allison Pryor (Sr. Prototyping Engineer, AWS), and Mohammad Salehan (Prototyping Engineer, AWS) as they discuss transforming healthcare through AI-powered medical record review.
Learn how Inovalon processes millions of medical records annually using LLMs and AWS services while maintaining regulatory compliance and human oversight. The conversation covers their journey from prototype to production, implementing solutions for risk adjustment and quality reporting, while tackling challenges like analyzing thousands of pages of medical documentation with consistent accuracy.
Discover how they've integrated advanced text processing, evidence highlighting, and human validation to create scalable solutions that improve healthcare delivery through better data analysis.

Do you have technical AWS questions? Ask the community of experts on AWS re:Post: https://go.aws/3lPaoPb
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services is the worldâ€™s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud, enabling customers to build anything they can imagine. We offer the greatest choice of innovative cloud capabilities and expertise, on the most extensive global infrastructure with industry-leading security, reliability, and performance.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]The Best Thing That Could Happen to the Energy Industry | Matt Tilleard | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Best Thing That Could Happen to the Energy Industry | Matt Tilleard | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
History has been written by whoever controls the dominant fuel of the era â€” until now, says renewables entrepreneur Matt Tilleard. He explains why, as the clean energy transition ramps up, weâ€™re moving from a world where energy comes from burning fuels to one where it will come from using technology. Learn why this could change everything about global power dynamics â€” and why the future belongs not to those who control resources, but to those who build and share technology. (Recorded at TED Countdown Summit 2025 on June 16, 2025)

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]All eyes on Meta's smart glasses | Vergecast

ns2:group.ns2:title: All eyes on Meta's smart glasses | Vergecast
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Metaâ€™s smart glasses have been a hit in part because they donâ€™t try to do too much. With the new Display glasses, though, Meta is trying to do... a lot more. The Vergeâ€™s Victoria Song joins the show to tell us about her experience with the glasses, from the impressive but very first-gen hardware to the somewhat underwhelming set of things you can do. After that, podcaster and creator Stephen Robles explains to David why heâ€™s dead wrong about Apple Shortcuts. Stephen shares how he uses Shortcuts, why heâ€™s found such a big audience of Shortcuts fans on YouTube and elsewhere, and why itâ€™s worth doing the work to learn Appleâ€™s most powerful app. Finally, David answers a question from the Vergecast Hotline (call 866-VERGE11 or email vergecast@theverge.com!) about which wireless earbuds you should buy â€” and why it might be the pair you already own.
00:00 Intro 03:05 Discussion on Smart Glasses Usability 21:13 Privacy Concerns and Ethical Implications 36:23 Apple Shortcuts Debate 42:18 Enhancing Screenshots with iPhone Frames 43:17 Creating and Sharing Shortcuts 43:44 Automating Daily Tasks with Shortcuts 45:47 Advanced Shortcuts and Apple Intelligence 49:07 Building Custom Shortcuts for Unique Needs 58:06 The Future of Shortcuts and AI Integration 01:00:05 Practical Uses and Community Requests 01:06:22 Challenges and Improvements in Shortcuts 01:14:36 Vergecast Hotline

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Securing Agentic Workflows Using AWS and Coalfire | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Securing Agentic Workflows Using AWS and Coalfire | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Join Nate Dehmuth (Vice President of AI and Services at Coalfire) and Saptarshi Banerjee (AWS Senior Solutions Architect) to explore building secure, autonomous AI agents with reliable security and privacy controls. Through a real-world case study of support ticket processing agents, this session addresses key challenges including inconsistent processing, inappropriate tool usage, and security violations like PII exposure. Learn how Coalfire's Secure Agent Construct maps to AWS services to implement proper isolation, permissions, and feedback loops. Discover repeatable design patterns that ensure autonomous agents operate safely within enterprise expectations while delivering reliable outcomes. Perfect for architects, developers, and security professionals seeking to deploy secure AI agents using AWS primitives and Coalfire's proven methodologies
Learn more at: https://go.aws/47hRqUQ
